body.p: Which of the following is not properly matched with its function?

multiple_choice.choice: tricuspid valve - separates the right atrium from the right ventricle
aortic valve - prevents back flow from the aorta into the left ventricle
pulmonary semilunar valve - blood flows from the left ventricle out to the body through this valve
bicuspid valve - prevents backflow from the left ventricle to left atrium

feedback.p: Incorrect. The tricuspid valve does prevents backflow of blood from the right ventricle to the right atrium.
Incorrect. The aortic valve is found between the left ventricle and aorta, preventing backflow of blood.
Correct. The pulmonary semilunar valve is between the right ventricle and pulmonary artery, carrying blood to the lungs, not the rest of the body.
Incorrect. The bicuspid valve is found between the left atrium and left ventricle, preventing backflow of blood.
